instructions: You have been asked to participate in an economics experiment. For your participation today we will pay you $3 in cash at the end of the experiment. After the proposal forms have been returned to Room A each person will be paid. Each person will receive $3 for participating in this experiment. In this experiment each of you will be paired with a different person who is in another room. You will not be told who these people are either during or after the experiment, and they will not be told who you are. A sum of $5 has been provisionally allocated to each pair and the person in Room A can propose how much of this each person is to receive. To do this, the person in Room A must fill out a form titled 'Proposal Form'. The person in Room B will then be given a chance to accept or reject the proposal. If the person in Room B accepts the proposal, then both people in the pair receive the amount shown on the proposal form. If the person in Room B rejects the proposal, then both people in the pair receive zero.

items.question: How much of the $5 pie do you allocate to the person in Room B?
